intro: Oplismenus compositus f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in spikelets. The plant is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in wet, swampy habitats. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, which gives it the common name "hairy yellow-eyed grass." The inflorescence is typically terminal, with the flowers arranged in a loose, open cluster.
